page.title: 04School closure threat.
page.content: Nether Wyresdale St.Peter's C.of E. School,Scorton,has been educating village children for over a century. Today there are 25 juniors and 17 infants on roll.They are taught by 1 part_time and 2 full_time teachers helped by a nursery assistant. The school is associated with St.Peter's parish and pupils take part in church services such as Harvest Festival.The "Friends of Scorton School"arrange social and fund_raising events and provide many pieces of extra equipment for the school. In 1984 when the County Council served a closure notice on the school there were strong protests and an Action Committee presented the case for retaining the school.The closure notice was withdrawn in summer 1985.
